column4: how do I restore windows xp in Grub and have it be the 1st one on the menu?
What version are you on?
how do I find that out?
cat /etc/issue
if your on ubuntu 10.10 goto /boot/grub/menu.lst vim the file and edit to resleft your changes you can place XP on the top of the list
something similiar to title DOZ    root hd(0,0)     chainloader +1   makeactive
what is DOZ?
You can google for more information https://help.ubuntu.com/community/WindowsDualBoot
Its just the TITLE for the OS> (What it will display at the grub meny during bootime)(
this goes in grub.cfg or /etc/grub.d ?
Neither if your on 10.10 its /etc/grub/menu.lst if your on 11.04 its grub.cfg
is not supposed to be in /etc/grub.d and then run update-grub?
what?
to boot windows first! grub.cfg says that "It is automatically generated by grub-mkconfig using templates"
no You dont need all those commands. Just add in your windows title and stuff and reboot. It will work.
You can update grub using update-grub2 or w.e but i dont think you need to
on top? of grub.cfg ?
so add http://pastebin.com/Q2EQz87P as the first part of /boot/grub/grub.cfg ?
Try Running update-grub like he said. If that doesnt work add something simliar like :http://pastebin.com/p9ZdUv47 to your file but you shouldnt need to
when you say "to your file" do you mean 40_custom?
yeah
